description:
Very unstable. It abruptly gets terminated when runnnig over night and never completes downloads. 

To store playable audio files across different devices, you have to purchase the license, meaning this is not practically free for most users.

Even if you purchase a license, there is no support for paid users. You have to post issues on GitHub which requires an account and login. Even if you ask somthing, you'll get unfriendly responses from an unmotivated tech and can hardly expect your problems to be fixed.

This program does not Function in Opensuse.

Will Not Run!

Earlier/Older versions loaded and ran without incident.

I have more than a hundred books in my audible account and counting. And sometimes I need to listen to them offline on my PC with Cozy or on my watch. OpenAudible really helps me put my books on all devices I want and also having a backup on my PC.
After installation I was not able to import any books from my collection. I am not willing to shell out $25 for product I cannot even try.
Could not test any functions 'not available in trial version'

Running Fedora 37 KDE and it installed but when I try to run it, it tried to load and then shuts down. I checked the permissions and it is under root so I dont know if that makes a difference. Im not running under root

Tut genau das, was es soll! 
Vielen Dank dafür :-)

OpenAudible requires a valid license to use the latest version of the software. A license is valid forever. Free updates are available for one year. If your license is more than a year old, you can keep using your current version indefinitely. Upgrading to a version created after your 1 year license will require a low-cost upgrade
